title:
Ensure 'Routing and Remote Access (RemoteAccess)'
is set to 'Disabled'
description:
Offers routing services to businesses in local area and wide area network environments.
The recommended state for this setting is: Disabled.
rationale:
This service's main purpose is to provide Windows router functionality - this is not an
appropriate use of workstations in an enterprise managed environment.
impact:
The computer will not be able to be configured as a Windows router between different
connections.
audit_procedure:
Navigate to the UI Path articulated in the Remediation section and confirm it is set as
prescribed. This group policy setting is backed by the following registry location with a
REG_DWORD value of 4.
HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\RemoteAccess:Start
remediation_procedure:
To establish the recommended configuration, run the following PowerShell command:
Set-Service -Name RemoteAccess -StartupType Disabled
default_value:
Disabled
